headings.usage: Main headings, Hero text, Feature titles

usage_rules: Use 'background' (#FDFBF7) for the main page background to avoid sterile white.
Use 'primary' (#6366F1) for main CTAs (Upload, Sign Up).
Use 'accent' (#BEF264 - Acid Lime) for 'Success', 'Ready', or 'Magic' indicators to pop against the purple.
Use 'card' (#FFFFFF) with heavy shadows for containers.

textures: Dotted grid pattern in hero background

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:translate-y-[2px] hover:shadow-hover transition-all shadow-button rounded-full font-bold px-8 py-4
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-foreground border-2 border-foreground hover:bg-muted transition-all shadow-button rounded-full font-bold px-8 py-4

cards.default: bg-card text-card-foreground border-2 border-foreground rounded-xl shadow-card p-6

inputs.default: bg-white border-2 border-input focus:border-primary focus:ring-0 rounded-lg p-3

hero_before.description: Messy pile of clothes on bed - represents the 'Before' state

hero_after_1.description: Clean vintage denim flat lay - represents 'After' state

hero_after_2.description: Clean white sneaker product shot - represents 'After' state

motion.loading: Use a 'shimmer' effect or a spinning geometric shape, not a standard spinner.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text on 'primary' background is white. Ensure text on 'accent' background is dark.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible 2px offset ring on all interactive elements.

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Neo-Brutalist' shadow style (solid black offset shadows) for all cards and buttons.
Use the 'Outfit' font for all headings to give a modern, friendly feel.
The 'Upload Zone' should be a central feature: large, dashed border, interactive hover states.
Use the provided image URLs for the 'Before/After' slider demo in the Hero section.
Do NOT use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors or subtle patterns.
Ensure the mobile view is prioritized (large touch targets, stacked grids).
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI slop' aesthetics (generic gradients, centered text everywhere).
